source.bf522d83:
# importing required librarys
from nltk.corpus import stopwords
from spacy.lang.en.stop_words import STOP_WORDS
from wordcloud import WordCloud
# Create stopword list:
STOP_WORDS.add('otter')
stopwords = set(list(STOP_WORDS) +list(stopwords.words()))
stopwords.update(["br", "href", 'https'])
stopwords.update(stopwords)
textt = " ".join(desc for desc in zomatoData["dish_liked"])
wordcloud = WordCloud(stopwords=stopwords).generate(textt)
plt.imshow(wordcloud, interpolation='bilinear')
plt.axis("off")
plt.title('Most Liked Dishes',fontsize=20,fontweight='bold')
plt.savefig('wordcloud11.png')
plt.show()

source.7158a987:
# relpacing cost string to floats
Zomato['cost']=Zomato['cost'].astype(str)
Zomato['cost']=Zomato['cost'].apply(lambda x:x.replace(",","."))
Zomato['cost']=Zomato['cost'].astype(float)
Zomato.info()
source.61ad6801:
# Removing '/5' from  dataset
Zomato=Zomato.loc[Zomato.rate!='NEW']
Zomato=Zomato.loc[Zomato.rate!='-'].reset_index(drop=True)

Zomato['rate']=Zomato['rate'].astype(str)
Zomato['rate']=Zomato['rate'].apply(lambda x:x.replace("/5",''))
Zomato['rate']=Zomato['rate'].astype(float)
Zomato['rate'].unique()

source.b6799b9f:
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize']=(20,10)
Y=pd.crosstab(Zomato['rate'],Zomato['book_table'])
y=Y.div(Y.sum(1).astype(float),axis=0)
y.plot(kind='bar',stacked=True,color=['#849bad','#03fcca'])
plt.title("Rate  Vs  Table_booking",fontweight="bold",fontsize=30)
plt.legend(loc="upper right")
plt.ylabel("Table booking",fontsize=10,fontweight='bold')
plt.xlabel("Rate",fontsize=10,fontweight='bold')
plt.show()
source.085c1181:
sn.catplot(x="location", y="rate", kind="boxen",data=Zomato.sort_values("location"))
plt.xticks(rotation=90)

plt.title('Loaction Rating',fontsize=20,fontweight='bold')
plt.ylabel("locations",fontsize=15,fontweight='bold')
plt.xlabel("Ratings",fontsize=15,fontweight='bold')
plt.xticks(fontsize=10,fontweight='bold')
plt.yticks(fontsize=10,fontweight='bold')

source.bb259c15:
**Zomatois an Indian multinational restaurant aggregator and food delivery company founded by Deepinder Goyal, Pankaj Chaddah, and Gunjan Patidar in 2008. Zomato provides information, menus and user-reviews of restaurants as well as food delivery options from partner restaurants in select cities.**

Zomato is good for restaurants around the world.
In analysis we are going to di
**importing libararys** : for the analysis some library are required for processing of dataset

**Data cleanig and Standardition** 

>*Droping null  values 

>*Deleting  some unnessesory Restaurant columns

>*Renaming the Columns

>*Droping duplicates

>*cleaning individual columns

>*Remove the NaN values from Data sets

>*Some Transformations


**Data Visualization** :Using  plots to find relations between the features
>*Restaurant Delivering omline or not

>*Restaurant allowing Table booking or not

>*Table booking Rate Vs Rate

>*Best locations

>*Relation bettween Location and Rating

>*Restaurant Type

>*Gaussion Rest type and Rating

>*Types of services

>*Relation Between Type and Rating

>*Cost of restaurant in location

> *Restaurant type

> *Most famous restaurant chainsi in Bangaluru
